fine_dining.name: Frantzén
signature_dishes: Multi-course tasting menu focused on seasonal luxury ingredients
fine_dining.atmosphere: Exclusive and intimate multi-level dining experience
fine_dining.booking_tips: Extremely difficult to book; reservations open specific dates months in advance; requires prepayment
fine_dining.local_tips: Sweden's only three-Michelin-starred restaurant; offers a unique fixed menu experience combining Nordic ingredients with Japanese influences; prepare for a significant splurge.

fine_dining.name: Ekstedt
signature_dishes: Dishes cooked solely over birch wood fire, cast iron, or in a wood-fired oven
fine_dining.atmosphere: Rustic yet sophisticated, focused around the open kitchen fire
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance; specify allergies when booking; seating near the kitchen offers a view of the cooking process
fine_dining.local_tips: Unique concept where all food is cooked without electricity or gas, using traditional Scandinavian techniques over open flames; offers a smoky, intense flavour profile.

fine_dining.name: Gastrologik
signature_dishes: Fixed tasting menu based entirely on the best available Swedish produce of the day
fine_dining.atmosphere: Minimalist, elegant, and focused on the dining experience
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead; the menu is decided daily based on ingredient availability, making each visit unique; inform about dietary needs in advance.
fine_dining.local_tips: Emphasizes close relationships with local farmers and producers; known for its innovative and pure flavors showcasing Swedish ingredients; offers a surprise menu.

casual_dining.name: Pelikan
signature_dishes: SOS (Smör, Ost och Sill - Butter, Cheese, and Herring)
Fläsklägg med Rotmos (Pork Shank with Root Vegetable Mash)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic, bustling beer hall atmosphere with high ceilings and traditional decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Can get loud; great for experiencing classic Swedish dishes in a traditional setting
casual_dining.local_tips: A Stockholm institution since 1733 (in various locations); serves hearty, authentic Swedish home-style cooking; large portions; good selection of beer and snaps.

casual_dining.name: Meatballs for the People
signature_dishes: Meatballs made from various meats (Elk, Wild Boar, Reindeer, Vegetarian)
Served with traditional accompaniments (potato purée, cream sauce, lingonberries, pickled cucumber)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Trendy yet cozy bistro dedicated to meatballs
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular spot, booking advised; try different types of meatballs
casual_dining.local_tips: Focuses exclusively on high-quality, often organic, meatballs; great place to sample variations of Sweden's most famous dish.

casual_dining.name: Kvarnen
signature_dishes: Biff Rydberg (Diced beef tenderloin, onion, potato, egg yolk)
Wallenbergare (Veal patty with potato purée, peas, lingonberries)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Large, traditional beer hall with historical ambiance, separate dining room
casual_dining.booking_tips: Beer hall section is more casual and often crowded; dining room offers a calmer experience
casual_dining.local_tips: Another Södermalm institution (over 100 years old); serves classic Swedish dishes and has a wide beer selection; featured in Stieg Larsson's Millennium trilogy.

casual_dining.name: Östermalms Korvspecialist
signature_dishes: Wide variety of high-quality sausages from around the world (e.g., Merguez, Kabanoss, Thüringer)
Served with sauerkraut, potato salad, various mustards
casual_dining.atmosphere: Legendary, tiny street food kiosk with outdoor standing tables
casual_dining.booking_tips: Be prepared to queue, especially at lunchtime; cash often preferred
casual_dining.local_tips: Elevated hot dog experience; considered a Stockholm classic for a quick, high-quality bite; popular with locals from all walks of life.

street_food.name: Tunnbrödsrulle Stands (various locations)
specialties: Tunnbrödsrulle (Flatbread wrap with sausage, mashed potatoes, shrimp salad, lettuce, onion)
street_food.location: Various street corners, squares (e.g., near Slussen, Medborgarplatsen)
street_food.local_tips: The quintessential Swedish street food experience, especially after a night out; a unique combination of ingredients in a soft flatbread wrap.

street_food.name: Strömmingsvagnen (Herring Wagon)
specialties: Stekt Strömming (Fried Baltic Herring) served with mashed potatoes, lingonberries, pickled cucumber, on crispbread (knäckebröd) or soft bread.
street_food.location: Slussen area (Kornhamnstorg - location can sometimes vary slightly)
street_food.local_tips: Iconic food truck serving a Stockholm classic; fried herring is a traditional dish; look for the wagon usually parked near the locks at Slussen.

street_food.name: Food Trucks (various locations)
specialties: Diverse offerings: Gourmet Burgers, Tacos, Asian Fusion, Vegan options
street_food.location: Often congregate in areas like Hornstull Marknad (weekends), near office districts, or special events. Check websites/apps like StreetKäk for locations.
street_food.seating: Variable (often none or limited public seating nearby)
street_food.local_tips: Stockholm has a growing food truck scene offering diverse and often high-quality fast food; check online resources for current locations and operating times.

coffee_shops.name: Vete-Katten
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional, elegant, labyrinthine cafe with multiple rooms and old-world charm
coffee_shops.food_options: Extensive selection of cakes, pastries, sandwiches, light lunches
coffee_shops.local_tips: A true Stockholm institution founded in 1928; perfect for experiencing traditional Swedish fika; can get busy but usually possible to find a seat in one of the many rooms.

coffee_shops.name: Drop Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist, bright, coffee-focused cafe; knowledgeable baristas
coffee_shops.local_tips: Award-winning specialty coffee shop known for its high-quality, light-roast beans sourced globally; popular with coffee aficionados; located in Södermalm.

coffee_shops.name: Fabrique Stenugnsbageri (various locations)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Rustic-chic bakeries with a focus on stone oven baking
coffee_shops.wifi_friendly: Varies by location (some are small/takeaway focused)
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular chain known for excellent sourdough bread and high-quality buns, especially their cardamom buns; multiple locations across Stockholm.

bars.name: Pharmarium
signature_drinks: Inventive cocktails with unique ingredients and presentation, often using herbs and bitters
Menu inspired by old pharmacy recipes
bars.atmosphere: Intimate, dimly lit, historic setting resembling an old pharmacy in Stortorget (Gamla Stan)
bars.local_tips: Located in Stockholm's oldest pharmacy building; offers creative and well-crafted cocktails in a unique, atmospheric setting; great for a special night out in the Old Town.

bars.name: Tjoget
bars.type: Multi-Concept Bar (Cocktail Bar, Wine Bodega, Beer Café)
signature_drinks: Excellent classic and signature cocktails at Linje Tio
Good wine selection at Hornstulls Bodega
bars.atmosphere: Large, lively venue divided into distinct sections; industrial-chic design
bars.food_options: Dining available, particularly Mediterranean-inspired food at Linje Tio
bars.reservation_needed: Recommended for dining or larger groups at Linje Tio
bars.local_tips: Frequently listed among the World's 50 Best Bars; offers something for everyone with its different concepts under one roof; located in Hornstull, Södermalm.

bars.name: Omnipollos Hatt
signature_drinks: Wide range of Omnipollo beers on tap (often experimental and unique)
Guest taps featuring other craft breweries
bars.atmosphere: Casual, hip, often crowded bar known for its excellent beer and pizza
bars.food_options: Creative sourdough pizzas with unusual toppings
bars.local_tips: A must-visit for craft beer lovers; Omnipollo is a highly regarded Swedish brewery; expect a lively atmosphere and potentially a wait for tables; located near Slussen.

bars.name: ICEBAR Stockholm by ICEHOTEL
bars.specialty: Drinks served in glasses made of ice in a -5°C environment
bars.atmosphere: Bar made entirely of ice, including walls, bar, tables, and glasses; themed designs change periodically
bars.reservation_needed: Highly recommended; book timed entry slots
bars.local_tips: The world's first permanent ice bar; located within Hotel C Stockholm near the Central Station; entry includes rental of a warm poncho and gloves; a unique, albeit touristy, experience.

food_tours.name: The Stockholm Food Tour
highlights: Sampling traditional Swedish dishes (like herring, meatballs)
Visiting key food spots like Östermalms Saluhall
Tasting modern Nordic cuisine elements
Learning about Swedish food culture and history
food_tours.booking_tips: Provides a good overview of Swedish food; wear comfortable shoes for walking; book online in advance.

food_tours.name: Nordic Food Walk
highlights: Focus on seasonal Nordic ingredients
Tasting specialties from Sweden and neighboring Nordic countries
Visiting specialty food stores and markets
Understanding the New Nordic Cuisine philosophy
food_tours.booking_tips: Good for those interested in the broader Nordic food scene; emphasizes quality ingredients and culinary traditions.

food_tours.name: Swedish Fika Tour
highlights: Understanding the concept and importance of fika
Visiting traditional cafes and modern coffee shops
Sampling classic fika pastries (like Kanelbullar, Chokladbollar)
Tasting Swedish coffee
food_tours.booking_tips: A shorter tour focused specifically on the Swedish coffee break tradition; great way to discover good cafes and pastries.

cooking_classes.name: Swedish Meatball Cooking Class
what_you_learn: Making meatballs from scratch (often using a traditional recipe)
Preparing classic accompaniments (cream sauce, potato purée, lingonberries, pickled cucumber)
Techniques for achieving the right texture and flavor
includes: Hands-on cooking, ingredients, recipes, meal featuring the meatballs made
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Popular class focusing on Sweden's most famous dish; book ahead; learn the secrets to authentic Köttbullar.

cooking_classes.name: Swedish Baking Class (Kanelbullar & More)
what_you_learn: Baking Cinnamon Buns (Kanelbullar) and/or Cardamom Buns (Kardemummabullar)
Techniques for yeasted doughs and shaping buns
Often includes other fika treats like Chokladbollar (Chocolate Balls)
includes: Hands-on baking, ingredients, recipes, fika with the baked goods
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Learn to make essential Swedish fika pastries; great hands-on experience; take home delicious results (and skills).

markets.name: Östermalms Saluhall
highlights: High-quality butchers, fishmongers, cheese shops
Delicatessens and specialty food vendors
Several restaurants and cafes within the hall
Beautiful historic building (reopened after renovation)
markets.hours: Mon-Fri approx. 9:30 AM - 7 PM, Sat approx. 9:30 AM - 5 PM (individual vendor hours may vary)
markets.local_tips: Upscale food hall dating back to 1888; great place to buy high-quality Swedish ingredients or have lunch; beautifully restored architecture; more expensive than other markets.

markets.name: Hötorgshallen
highlights: Diverse range of international foods (Middle Eastern, Turkish, Balkan, Asian)
Swedish delicatessens, cheese, fish
Many lunch counters and small eateries
Located beneath the Hötorget square outdoor market
markets.hours: Mon-Thu approx. 10 AM - 6 PM, Fri 10 AM - 7 PM, Sat 10 AM - 4 PM
markets.local_tips: Lively, diverse food hall offering a mix of Swedish and international flavors; great spot for a quick and varied lunch; more bustling and less formal than Östermalms Saluhall.

markets.name: Söderhallarna
highlights: Mix of specialty food shops (cheese, meat, fish)
Systembolaget (state liquor store)
Several restaurants and cafes
Cinema complex
markets.hours: Mon-Fri approx. 10 AM - 7 PM, Sat 10 AM - 5 PM (restaurants may stay open later)
markets.local_tips: Modern food hall integrated into a larger complex; offers a good range of food options and shops in the heart of Södermalm; convenient location.

spring: Nässelsoppa (Nettle Soup) - Made from young stinging nettles
Asparagus (Sparris) - Often served simply with butter or hollandaise
Rhubarb (Rabarber) - Used in pies, crumbles, and compotes
Matjes Herring (Matjessill) - Young herring, typically eaten around Midsummer (late Spring/early Summer)
summer: Kräftskiva (Crayfish Parties) - Boiled crayfish eaten outdoors (typically August)
Färskpotatis (New Potatoes) - Small, delicate potatoes boiled with dill
Fresh Berries - Strawberries (Jordgubbar), Blueberries (Blåbär), Raspberries (Hallon), Cloudberries (Hjortron)
Grilled Foods (Grillat) - Sausages, meats, fish cooked outdoors
autumn: Root Vegetables - Parsnips, Swede, Carrots used in stews and roasts
Apples (Äpplen) - Used in cakes, pies, and sauces
winter: Julbord (Christmas Buffet) - Extensive spread including pickled herring, gravlax, Christmas ham (Julskinka), meatballs, Janssons Frestelse (potato-anchovy casserole)
Glögg (Mulled Wine) - Spiced warm wine, often served with almonds and raisins
Lussekatter (Saffron Buns) - Eaten around Lucia Day (Dec 13th)
Semlor - Cardamom buns filled with almond paste and whipped cream (traditionally eaten before Lent, now available Jan-Mar)
Ärtsoppa och Pannkakor (Pea Soup and Pancakes) - Traditional Thursday meal
